titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1672: Alchemical treatise.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Alchemical treatise concerning the creation of the philosopher's stone (p. 72) and on transmutation of metals such as gold, silver, lead, and mercury. Also includes a table of contents (p.169).

author.name: Charles Rainsford Collection of Alchemical and Occult Manuscripts (University of Pennsylvania)

supportDesc.extent: 124 leaves : 211 x 150 (172 x 110) mm bound to 225 x 161 mm +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (contemporary paper) + 124 + ii (contemporary paper) leaves; [xxxvi], 1-11, [v], 12-22, [v], 23-29, [v], 30-39, [vi], 41-56, [iv], 57-64, [iv], 65-71, [v], 72-122, [i], 123-152, [ii], 153-168, [169-176]; contemporary pagination in ink, modern pagination in pencil, upper outer corners.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 19-20 long lines; ruled in red pencil or crayon.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand, with marginal notes in a second hand.

origin.p: Written in Italy in the second half of the 18th century.

history.provenance: Sold at auction at Sotheby's (London), 15 July 2014, as part of Lot 411.
Owned by the 2nd through 12th Dukes of Northumberland, ms. 583, Alnwick Castle, Northumberland, 1809-2014 (bookplate, inside upper cover; stamps throughout).
Formerly owned by Charles Rainsford (British army officer, fellow of the Royal Society, and alchemist); bequeathed by Rainsford to Hugh Percy, Second Duke of Northumberland.
